_exec_summary.SummaryText:
RESPONSE HAS BEEN COORINATED WITH THE COMMUNITY RESPONSE PLAN.  THE OTHER EPA# 055387NB001.
PLANT MANAGER:    WM. H. OELTJEN

RISK MANAGEMENT---EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

1)  THE FACILITY POLICY
     A)  THE SHAREHOLDERS, MANAGEMENT AND EMPLOYEES OF CRESTON FERTILIZER CO, INC. ARE
COMMITTED TO THE PREVENTION OF ANY ACCIDENTAL RELEASE OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA.  IF AN
ACCIDENTAL RELEASE SHOULD OCCUR, THE FACILITY IS PREPARED TO WORK WITH THE LOCAL FIRE
DEPARTMENT, OR OTHER AUTHORITIES, TO MITIGATE ANY RELEASE AND MINIMIZE THE IMPACT OF THE
RELEASE TO THE PEOLE AND THE ENVIRONMENT.

2)    THE PRIMARY ACTIVITY AT THE FACILITY IS THE STORAGE AND BLENDING OF FETILIZERS FOR SALE TO THE FARMERS.
ANHYDROUS AMMONIA IS RECEIVED, STORED, AND DISTIBUTED FOR APPLICATION FOR A CROP PROTECTION NUTRIENT.
THE MAXIMUM QUANITY STORED WOULD BE 126,000# IN AN 18,000 GAL. STORAGE TANK.  THE MAXIMUM QUANITY HANDLED WOULD BE THE UNLOADING OF A SEMI-TRANSPORT CONTAINING 41,OOO#

3)     THE WORST CASE RELEASE SCENARIO WOULD BE THE RELEASE OF THE TOTAL CONTENTS OF A STORAGE TANK.  THE MAXIMUM QUANTITY RELEASE WOULD BE 79,000 LBS. WHICH REPRESENTS THE VOLUME OF THE STORAGE TANK AT 85% CAPACITY AS LIMITED BY DESIGN STANDARDS.

4)     THE FACILITY HAS IMPLEMENTED THE PROVISIONS OF "SAFETY REQUIREMENTS FOR THE STORAGE AND HANDLING OF ANHYDOUS AMMONIA, K-61.1"   PUBLISHED BY THE AMERICAN NATIONAL STANDARDS INSTITUTE, INC. AND THE STANDARDS OF THE U.S. OCCUPATIONAL SAFETY AND HEALTH ADMINISTRATION (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111.  "STORAGE AND HANDLING OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA".


5)     THE FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY
         A) THERE HAVE BEEN NO ACCIDENTAL RELEASE OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA IN THE PAST FIVE YEARS THAT:
                    HAVE CAUSED ANY DEATH, INJURY, OR SIGNIFICANT PROPERTY DAMAGE AT THE FACILITY: NOR TO OUR KNOWLEDGE, HAVE RESULTED IN OFF SITE DEATHS, INJURIES, EVACUATIONS, SHELTERING IN PLACE, PROPERTY DAMAGE OR ENVIRONMENTAL DAMAGE. 


6)     THE EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM.
        A) CRESTON FERTILIZER

HAS PROVIDED THE STATE AND LOCAL AUTHORITIES THE EMERGENCY PLANNING AND COMMUNITY RIGHT TO KNOW INFORMATION AS REQUIRED UINDER SARA TITLE III.


7)     PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY.
               SAFETY IMPROVEMENT IS AN ON GOING PROCESS AT THE FACILITY. PERIODIC EVALUATIONS ARE PERFORMED TO ASSESS THE MAINTENANCE OF SAFE CONDITIONS,.  THERE ARE NO ADDITIONAL SPECIFIC ANHYDROUS AMMONIA SAFETY RECOMMENDATIONS FOR IMPLEMENTATION ATHTHIS TIME.
